rdlst.sndbt: Ignite Stroller seems so comfortable, I want to ride in it!!!
rdlst.cntnt: After a lot of research, we decided to buy the Ignite Stroller for an upcoming trip in which we would be doing A LOT of walking for our 2 1/2 year old. We had another bigger and bulkier stroller that we normally use, but we wanted something light weight for the trip. After we purchased the stroller for an amazing price, we had to open it up and try...

I originally purchased a Graco Metrolite for my son, and then realized just how heavy it was getting in and out of my vehicle all the time.  What a pain! I came across this stroller one day on Amazon.com and decided to order it.  Am I ever glad I did! This has all the features of my Metrolite, but is considerably lighter, and has almost...

rdlst.sndbt: First Years Ignite you get your moneys worth adn more
rdlst.cntnt: i was in the market for a stroller.  i wanted it to be cheap. i wanted it to go to at least 50 pounds. well, i came across a deal for the first years ignite stroller.  i had never heard of it, nor had i seen it becuase it isn't available in any stores around here.  i decided it was worth a try for the price.  i am very happy w...

We purchased this umbrella stroller to downsize the amount of baby gear in the trunk of my car.  It folds up quickly and easily and takes up very little space in the trunk.  It is perfect for short shopping trips, or for when you don't want to lug around the big stroller.  It does have a recline option, and my 9 1/2 month old keeps i...

rdlst.sndbt: The First Years Ignite Stroller is a great umbrella stroller.
rdlst.cntnt: The First Years Ignite Stroller was a great purchase. I picked it over the Jet model because it seemed a bit sturdier, allowed the seat to recline more than the Jet, and I was able to snag it at the same price as the Jet. Although it weighs quite a bit, pulling in and out of car trunk can sometimes be a hassle, the construction is amazing for an ...
